abstract: The cable pioneer John C. Malone has a history of parlaying minority stakes in companies into advantageous deals for himself.
snippet: The cable pioneer John C. Malone has a history of parlaying minority stakes in companies into advantageous deals for himself.
lead_paragraph: John C. Malone has slipped through the door again. The American cable magnate is buying 27 percent of Charter Communications from three buyout firms for $2.6 billion. He’s no garden-variety minority owner, though. Even heavyweights like Rupert Murdoch and Barry Diller can attest to Mr. Malone’s cunning use of smaller stakes. Charter investors should keep their guards up.
